intro: Apama tomentosa var. lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly apama, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its dense, soft, woolly covering on its stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a pale to yellowish color. The species is noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in humid climates.
